result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Squirrel Davis

records.addlTxt:
Cash bail to remain as set until bed becomes available.
Upon placement, bail to convert to $250.00 signature bond with turnover to JusticePoint DTC monitoring for placement.

Defendant David Squirrel Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for David Squirrel Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months. 

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Vincent Guimont
Received and Filed: Attorney Zoe Plovanich

Defendant David Squirrel Davis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for David Squirrel Davis.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin.

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense informs the court that Mr. Davis is almost admitted into drug treatment court and requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Squirrel Davis not in court, in custody.  Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court for David Squirrel Davis.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a status conference.  Defense informs the court that Drug Treatment Court Application has been submitted and is pending approval.  Court scheduled another status conference.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, defendant David Squirrel Davis not in court, in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Squirrel Davis in court with Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont; both appear by video.  Defendant David Squirrel Davis in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Robakowski. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Vincent Paul Guimont in court, appear by video defendant David Squirrel Davis not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness fail to appear due to being on vacation. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 5 SUPERVISION. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Westown Green Residential Building, 925 N. MLK, Jr. Drive, Milwaukee. The defendant is to remain 500 feet away from all grounds, all residents and employees known to defendant to reside and/or work there, buildings, parking lots, and sidewalks that are in contact with the building.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David Squirrel Davis in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Defendant David Squirrel Davis in custody.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM AND LIVE STREAM ON DA CAST.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K WARRANT
